Award.AwardTitle: Conference: Albany 2019: The 20th Conversation, June 11-15, 2019; Albany, NY

Division.LongName: Div Of Molecular and Cellular Bioscience

Award.AbstractNarration:
The Albany Conversations provide a venue for an intellectually challenging debate of topics of current interest in structural biology. The sessions dealing with cryo-electron microscopy and protein dynamics in the living cytoplasm will emphasize recent technological breakthroughs in structural biology. Lectures by young researchers (graduate students, post-doctoral fellows and starting faculty) will be based on selection from abstracts submitted for poster presentation.

The Albany Conversations will include about 400 participants, over 200 posters, and ~85 oral presentations, about one third of which will be selected from the posters. Out of all the talks, at least 34-36 will be delivered by female scientists. The final program will contain a socially responsible mix of men and women with wide ethnic origin. All presenters are expected to stay during most of the conference, eat at the community tables and be available for interactions with junior and senior colleagues.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
• Award Title: Conference: Albany 2019: The 20th Conversation, June 11-15, 2019; Albany, NY
  • Federal Award ID: 1903131
  • Report Submission Period: 06/01/2019 to 05/31/2020

The 20th Conversation, June 11-15 2019, was attended by over 500 delegates from over 20 countries. Over 175 poster presentation papers were exhibitted, in addition to lectures from leading scientists including Nobel Laureate Jochim Frank. There was a deep special session on cryoelectron microscopy indicating its emerging importance in solving many of the biological structural problems associated with diseases.

The Conversation was organized by a cmtte consiting of Maxim Frank Kamenetskii, Boston University, Anthony Maxwell, JIC, Norwich UK, Zippi Shakked, Weizmann Institute, Rehovot, Israel, Wilma Olson, Rutgers University, Leonid Mirney, MIT and Victor Zhurkin, National Institutes of Health.

The Organizing Cmtte selected young scientists from the  abstracts submitted to provide short lectures during the main session; and they were sandwiched between very senior speakers to draw attention to the high quality of the work  and research being performed by the young doctral students in structural biology from across the world. 

The complete Book of Abstarcts was published as one of the special issues of the Journal of Biomolecular Structure & Dynamics,Volume 37 Supplement,  2019, and was freely distributed. The various delegates stayed within University housing, about 5 minutes walk from the Conversation site.
